summary: Kinshasa is the capital and biggest city of the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC). It's one of the world's fastest-growing cities, with an estimated population of 17 million in 2024. The city was first known as LÃ©opoldville but changed its name to Kinshasa in 1966. It's a major center for business, politics, and culture. Kinshasa is also home to important buildings like the Palais du Peuple and the National Museum. The city lies along the Congo River and shares a border with the Republic of the Congo. People who live there are called Kinois.
title: Kinshasa
